channel.title: Starter position
channel.description: [317] Where can i change the starter position if a new player logs in. And where to change teleports in mage book . Can't find it in my Java files.

item.title: Starter position
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Player class. Do a search for “initial”. You’ll find the X/Y Coordinates inside that method.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter position
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

[size=10pt]All from memory again but…
In delta sources for teleports…you should find the cases for clicking buttons in either clickingbuttons.java or under case 185 in the client.java.
But that may only be to make where clicking the teleports take you. If the name for the teleports can’t be found in the client.java[/size] (by clicking ctrl + f and searching one of your teleports names) then they may be in a texthandler.java is deltas have them.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter position
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

Config - Pi
Player - Delta

For starting point.

Teleports in magebook are in clickingbuttons for pi, and client or something like that for delta I’m not sure if that’s correct because I don’t use delta.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter position
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

[quote=“imstrength, post:10, topic:464333”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=568240.msg4126518#msg4126518 date=1350500087]
It’s a 317 guys, I’m pretty sure config.java comes in the higher up revisions.
On Topic, check Player.java or sometimes Client.java, the best way to do it is log on to your server, and don’t move at all and take note of the coordinates of the spawn area.
[/quote]

not true [PI] ARE a 317, but you’re correct not ALL 317’s have a Config.java. and i don’t know of any Delta sources that do have on.[/quote]
Yeah PI’s are 317’s even though 99.9% of them load higher revision data.
Sorry, but you didn’t help answer the original question one bit… What was the point of posting this? To clear something up that wasn’t even a big deal?

Read full topic

item.title: Starter position
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

_sarah_:

It’s Delta Source if you wanna know

To change the spot where new players log-in:
Open Player.java and the rest if for you. (Hint: It’s most likely the only set of coordinates in the entire file but search “absx” if your still having trouble finding them.

To change teleports and the coordinates you spawn at when you die:
They’re in Client.java

P.S.
My hate for Delta’s has my computer without a single Delta source so I’m doing this from memory, but if you still need help I will download a source and help you more proficiently.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter position
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:5, topic:464333”]It’s a 317 guys, I’m pretty sure config.java comes in the higher up revisions.
On Topic, check Player.java or sometimes Client.java, the best way to do it is log on to your server, and don’t move at all and take note of the coordinates of the spawn area.[/quote]
Thanks for posting this before I got a chance to…Everyone now thinks everyone else uses later revision sources/PI’s which are not always the case. So for now on kids who are trying to be helpful…Try to remember their are more than 1 type of server source out there so if the person asking the question fails to state the exact source/base that he/she is using then why not ask in order to HELP them with their question properly? Otherwise your just posthunting lol!

Read full topic

It’s a 317 guys, I’m pretty sure config.java comes in the higher up revisions.
On Topic, check Player.java or sometimes Client.java, the best way to do it is log on to your server, and don’t move at all and take note of the coordinates of the spawn area.
